alert.note: Alert for Lake; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 1:35PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following areas, in north central Minnesota, Itasca and Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, Cook, Lake and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated river rises due to snowmelt. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Rain this weekend will increase snowmelt and runoff into area rivers and lakes. Visitors to areas popular for waterfall viewing should expect snow and ice covered trails and use caution with slippery rocks, cliffs, and strong currents around waterfalls. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
